intro: Thelypteris mjobergii, commonly known as the New Zealand tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Dryopteridaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate fronds. The plant has a distinctive crown of feathery fronds that can grow up to 3 meters in height. Its rhizome is thick and woody, allowing it to thrive in moist, shaded environments. Thelypteris mjobergii plays an important ecological role in New Zealand's native forests.
